intro: Cheirinia nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its blue or purple flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cheirinia nevadensis is often found in open areas such as meadows and slopes, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
